senses.sense_definition: To make a formal alteration in legislation, a report, or a document by adding, deleting, or rephrasing.

examples.text: The committee voted to <w>amend</w> the bill before the final reading.
You may need to <w>amend</w> your tax return if you made a mistake.

senses.sense_definition: To make something better or improve a situation or behavior.

examples.text: He promised to <w>amend</w> his ways and become a more responsible citizen.
We must take steps to <w>amend</w> the situation before it causes more problems.

senses.sense_definition: An act of correcting a mistake or providing compensation for a wrong.

examples.text: He tried to make an <w>amend</w> for his past errors, though it was difficult.
The apology served as an <w>amend</w> for the misunderstanding between them.

traits.comment: usually used in the plural form 'amends'

senses.sense_definition: A change or alteration made to a document; a clipping of the word amendment.

examples.text: I have sent the document back with a few <w>amends</w> for you to review.
Please check the <w>amends</w> in the contract before signing it.
Mr. <w>Amend</w> was known for his contributions to the local library.
We met a family named <w>Amend</w> during our travels.
